DOC.brief_summary: This study examine effectiveness aquatic therapy range MS-related symptom cognition , mood , fatigue quality life ( QOL ) .
DOC.detailed_description: Aim 1 . Examine impact aquatic exercise cognitive ability . The propose study test hypothesis , compare wait-list control group , treatment group demonstrate significantly great improvement cognitive outcome , specifically : processing speed , executive functioning , work memory long-term memory . Aim 2 . The current study examine impact aquatic exercise fatigue , mood , wellness , QOL physical functioning . Specifically investigator predict aquatic exercise lead improvement : 1.Fatigue 2 . Health relate QOL 3 . Depression/anxiety 4 . Self-efficacy 5 . Physical Functioning ( i.e . gait walk ) . Aim 3 : Examine long-term effect aquatic exercise outcome measure .
DOC.criteria: diagnosis MS. age 1865. read speak English fluently . history significant substance abuse . history neurological disease MS ( example , stroke , epilepsy , brain injury ) . history significant psychiatric illness ( example , bipolar disorder schizophrenia ) . complete least 30 minute moderate strenuous exercise least one day per week least past 6 month . diagnosis MS young 18 old 65 read speak English fluently . history significant substance abuse . history neurological disease MS ( example , stroke , epilepsy , brain injury ) . history significant psychiatric illness ( example , bipolar disorder schizophrenia ) . complete least 30 minute moderate strenuous exercise least one day per week least past 6 month .
